revised_title: A Determination of the Specific Heat of Water in Terms of the International Electric Units
tldr: The authors, Arthur Schuster and William Gannon, determine the specific heat of water using electric units and a simple method. They measure the electrical work done in a conductor and keep the electromotive force constant, allowing them to avoid estimating the excess temperature of the wire and measure time more accurately. The results provide a useful test of the agreement in determining the mechanical equivalent of heat through the heating of water by an electric current.
